description.narrative: Children and adolescents have access to improved opportunities for learning, including life skills and citizenship education, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, More girls and boys, including adolescents and the most vulnerable, benefitting from multiple pathways to quality learning, including life skills development and citizenship education, and protection

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents have access to improved opportunities for learning, including life skills and citizenship education

description.narrative: Positive progress achieved with UNICEF support in the curriculum reform in 2019 despite the slowdown of the reform include the roll-out of the pre-primary curriculum nationwide; the mainstreaming of life-skills and citizenship education in 3 curricula of the secondary cycle; and a strong dialogue and plans with development partners on implementation of in-service teacher training system strengthening plan. The new pre-service teacher training Bachelor on applied education sciences has delivered is first cohort of 2,450 teachers who have assumed function in public schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of Regional Education Commissions with a Regional Education Plan, including the preparatory year, defined by integrating the GBO approach
Number of continuing education modules designed for teaching and non-teaching staff, for implementation (training) through PREFAT funded by the World Bank
Number of children reached with pre-primary, primary and secondary online/distance education lesson with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
(alt) Number of children attending or going to school after reopening of schools [COVID]
System Strengthening - Skills - National curricula and training support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4), see guidance
